item.title: Does Nintendo's New Console Signal A 'Switch' For The Video Game Market?
item.description: March 5, 2017 - There's hype surrounding Nintendo's first home-to-handheld hybrid console, Switch. Wall Street Journal technology reporter Nathan Olivarez-Giles says this could be a make or break moment for Nintendo.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - There's hype surrounding Nintendo's first home-to-handheld hybrid console, Switch. Wall Street Journal technology reporter Nathan Olivarez-Giles says this could be a make or break moment for Nintendo. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/05/518663843/does-nintendos-new-console-signal-a-switch-for-the-video-game-market

item.title: As Amazon Moves In, A Local Bookseller Hopes To Thrive With A Personal Touch
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Amazon has opened its latest brick-and-mortar bookstore — the first on the East Coast. But an independent bookseller in the Boston suburb says: "I think that we're going to be OK."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Amazon has opened its latest brick-and-mortar bookstore — the first on the East Coast. But an independent bookseller in the Boston suburb says: "I think that we're going to be OK." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/04/517958727/as-amazon-moves-in-a-local-bookseller-hopes-to-thrive-with-a-personal-touch

item.title: How YouTube Is Changing Our Viewing Habits
item.description: March 4, 2017 - People watch 1 billion hours of video every day on YouTube. NPR's Scott Simon talks to Dr. Zeynep Tufekci of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill about YouTube's impact on society.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - People watch 1 billion hours of video every day on YouTube. NPR's Scott Simon talks to Dr. Zeynep Tufekci of the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill about YouTube's impact on society. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/04/518461970/how-youtube-is-changing-our-viewing-habits

item.title: St. Louis Man Accused Of Making Threats Against Jewish Centers, Schools
item.description: March 3, 2017 - The threats were allegedly part of the suspect's cyberstalking campaign against a woman with whom he once had a romantic relationship. Juan Thompson once worked as a reporter at The Intercept.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - The threats were allegedly part of the suspect's cyberstalking campaign against a woman with whom he once had a romantic relationship. Juan Thompson once worked as a reporter at The Intercept. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/03/518331335/st-louis-man-accused-of-making-threats-against-jewish-centers-schools

item.title: One Big Winner Of Snap's Even Bigger IPO: A School That Raked In Millions
item.description: March 3, 2017 - In 2012, Saint Francis High School put up $15,000 in seed money for the founders of a fledgling Snapchat. By the time the company went public Thursday, the school turned it into a $24 million return.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - In 2012, Saint Francis High School put up $15,000 in seed money for the founders of a fledgling Snapchat. By the time the company went public Thursday, the school turned it into a $24 million return. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/03/518316013/one-big-winner-of-snaps-even-bigger-ipo-a-school-that-raked-in-millions

item.title: Amazon And The $150 Million Typo
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Amazon said a mistyped command caused part of the company's cloud computing service to go down for hours on Tuesday. The Wall Street Journal reported the outage caused millions of dollars in losses.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Amazon said a mistyped command caused part of the company's cloud computing service to go down for hours on Tuesday. The Wall Street Journal reported the outage caused millions of dollars in losses. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/03/518322734/amazon-and-the-150-million-typo

item.title: Rise Of The Robot Bees: Tiny Drones Turned Into Artificial Pollinators
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Honeybees are a critical part of agriculture, pollinating many of our favorite crops. But bee deaths are on the rise. In Japan, scientists are testing whether insect-sized drones can help do the job.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Honeybees are a critical part of agriculture, pollinating many of our favorite crops. But bee deaths are on the rise. In Japan, scientists are testing whether insect-sized drones can help do the job. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/03/517785082/rise-of-the-robot-bees-tiny-drones-turned-into-artificial-pollinators

item.title: New Orleans' Police Use Of Body Cameras Brings Benefits And New Burdens
item.description: March 3, 2017 - The technology has improved police conduct and led to a drop in certain types of cases. But the body cams have added many extra hours of work watching videos for police and public defenders.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - The technology has improved police conduct and led to a drop in certain types of cases. But the body cams have added many extra hours of work watching videos for police and public defenders. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/03/517930343/new-orleans-police-use-of-body-cameras-brings-benefits-and-new-burdens

item.title: Mike Pence Used AOL Email For State Business As Indiana's Governor
item.description: March 3, 2017 - Public records obtained by The Indianapolis Star show that Pence communicated with advisers about security issues using the AOL account, which was hacked last year.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 3, 2017 - Public records obtained by The Indianapolis Star show that Pence communicated with advisers about security issues using the AOL account, which was hacked last year. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/03/518286557/mike-pence-used-aol-email-for-state-business-as-indiana-governor

item.title: Snapchat Goes Public In Largest Tech IPO Since Alibaba
item.description: March 2, 2017 - The popular video messaging service Snapchat went public Thursday under the name Snap Inc. It's the largest tech IPO since Alibaba in 2014. But Snap faces big obstacles, including how to broaden its audience, boost advertising sales and fend off competitors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - The popular video messaging service Snapchat went public Thursday under the name Snap Inc. It's the largest tech IPO since Alibaba in 2014. But Snap faces big obstacles, including how to broaden its audience, boost advertising sales and fend off competitors. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/02/518197167/snapchat-goes-public-in-largest-tech-ipo-since-alibaba

item.title: China Describes Its Vision Of Government-Controlled Internet
item.description: March 2, 2017 - In its first cyber policy paper, the Chinese government emphasize the idea that each country should govern the Internet as it sees fit, and insisted that the Internet in China is "fully open."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - In its first cyber policy paper, the Chinese government emphasize the idea that each country should govern the Internet as it sees fit, and insisted that the Internet in China is "fully open." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/02/518142482/china-describes-its-vision-of-government-controlled-internet

item.title: Parent Alert! Your Child Just Skipped Class
item.description:
March 2, 2017 - In a study, automated text messages to parents reduced absences and the number of F's earned by high school students.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/03/02/517757199/parent-alert-your-child-just-skipped-class
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Someday Disposable Drones May Deliver A Payload, Then Vanish
item.description: March 2, 2017 - DARPA, the Pentagon's R&D agency, is working with partners to develop low-cost gliders that travel about 100 miles and disappear within hours. The vehicles could have humanitarian and military uses.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - DARPA, the Pentagon's R&D agency, is working with partners to develop low-cost gliders that travel about 100 miles and disappear within hours. The vehicles could have humanitarian and military uses. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/02/517043932/someday-disposable-drones-may-deliver-their-load-then-vanish

item.title: Snapchat Parent's Stock Soars By 50 Percent On First Day Of Trading
item.description: March 2, 2017 - After pricing its initial public offering of 200 million nonvoting shares at $17 each, Snap Inc., saw the stock rise to more than $25 a share.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 2, 2017 - After pricing its initial public offering of 200 million nonvoting shares at $17 each, Snap Inc., saw the stock rise to more than $25 a share. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/02/518081927/snapchat-parent-to-begin-trading-on-the-new-york-stock-exchange-thursday

item.title: Uber CEO Apologizes Over Video Of Dispute With Driver
item.description: March 1, 2017 - Uber's founder Travis Kalanick says he needs leadership help. The frank acknowledgement comes after video surfaced of him berating an Uber driver, and follows a blistering blog post by a former engineer who said she was subjected to repeated sexual harassment and the company failed to stop it. The question many are asking now is whether Kalanick can continue to serve as the public face of the company he created.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

The question many are asking now is whether Kalanick can continue to serve as the public face of the company he created. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/01/517988142/uber-ceo-apologizes-over-video-of-dispute-with-driver
